summary: The Seattle Seahawks defeated the San Francisco 49ers 13-3, securing the NFC West title and the No. 1 seed in the NFC playoffs. Seattle will receive a first-round bye and home-field advantage. The 49ers, limited to a field goal, will enter the playoffs as either the No. 5 or No. 6 seed and will play on the road.

title: US flights to the Caribbean start again after airspace closed
snippets: US lifts Caribbean airspace curbs after attack on Venezuela Reuters
Airlines including United and Delta began restoring flights to Puerto Rico and other Caribbean destinations early Sunday after aviation authorities lifted temporary airspace restrictions.
The Federal Aviation Administration cited “safety-of-flight risks” in restricting the U.S.-controlled airspace as a result of the military operation in Venezuela.
JetBlue said it canceled about 215 flights “due to airspace closures across the Caribbean related to military activity.”
The US lifted airspace restrictions around the Caribbean after military operations in Venezuela upended travel in the region just as many vacationers are trying to get home from their winter breaks.

From outbound vacationers to students returning for the new semester, the US raid on Venezuela disrupted travel across the region.

summary: The US lifted temporary airspace restrictions over the Caribbean on Sunday, following military operations in Venezuela that had led to widespread flight cancellations. Airlines such as United, Delta, and JetBlue had suspended or canceled flights, affecting travelers returning from winter vacations. The Federal Aviation Administration cited safety concerns for the initial closures. Flight operations are now resuming.
